001package imagingbook.lib.util.bits;
002
003/**
004 * This class implements {@link BitVector} with internal 32-bit {@code int} data.
005 * @author WB
006 */
007public class BitVector32 implements BitVector {
008        
009        private static final int WL = 32;
010        
011        private final int[] data;
012        
013        /** The length of this bit vector */
014        public final int length;
015        
016        public BitVector32(int length) {
017                this.length = length;
018                int n = (length % WL == 0) ? length / WL : length / WL + 1;     // word count
019                this.data = new int[n];
020        }
021        
022        public BitVector32(byte[] bytes) {
023                this(bytes.length);
024                for (int i = 0; i < bytes.length; i++) {
025                        if (bytes[i] != 0) {
026                                this.set(i);
027                        }
028                }
029        }
030        
031        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
032
033        @Override
034        public int getLength() {
035                return this.length;
036        }
037        
038        @Override
039        public boolean get(int i) {
040                if (i < 0 || i >= length) {
041                        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("illegal index " + i);
042                }
043                final int mask = 1 << (i % WL);
044                return (data[i / WL] & mask) != 0;
045        }
046        
047        @Override
048        public void set(int i) {
049                if (i < 0 || i >= length) {
050                        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("illegal index " + i);
051                }
052                final int j = i / WL;   // word index
053                final int mask = 1 << (i % WL);
054                data[j] =  data[j] | mask;
055        }
056        
057        @Override
058        public void unset(int i) {
059                if (i < 0 || i >= length) {
060                        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("illegal index " + i);
061                }
062                final int j = i / WL;   // word index
063                final int mask = 0x01 << (i % WL);
064                data[j] =  data[j] & ~mask;
065        }
066        
067        @Override
068        public void setAll() {
069                for (int j = 0; j < data.length; j++) {
070                        data[j] = ~0;
071                }
072        }
073
074        @Override
075        public void unsetAll() {
076                for (int j = 0; j < data.length; j++) {
077                        data[j] = 0;
078                }
079        }
080        
081        @Override
082        public String toString() {
083                StringBuilder buf = new StringBuilder();
084                buf.append(BitVector32.class.getSimpleName() + "[");
085                for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
086                        buf.append(this.get(i) ? "1" : "0");
087                }
088                buf.append("]");
089                return buf.toString();
090        }
091        
092        
093        //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
094        
095//      public static void main(String[] args) {
096//              int K = 99;
097//              BitVector32 b = new BitVector32(K);
098//              
099//              System.out.println(b.toString());
100//              b.setAll();
101//              System.out.println(b.toString());
102//              b.unsetAll();
103//              System.out.println(b.toString());
104//              System.out.println();
105//              
106//              for (int i = 0; i < b.length; i++) {
107//                      b.set(i);
108//                      System.out.println(b.toString());
109//                      b.unset(i);
110//              }
111//      }
112
113}
